bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
When I attempt to install krita (the 3.0 packages (krita and krita-libs)) I get dependency errors.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): krita-3.0-3.fc25.x86_64
How reproducible: Everytime
Steps to Reproduce: 1. dnf install -y krita krita-libs 2. 3.
Actual results: Failed to synchronize cache for repo 'toshio-python-irclib-update', disabling. Failed to synchronize cache for repo 'livna', disabling. Failed to synchronize cache for repo 'robotmaxtron-Fakehal', disabling. Last metadata expiration check: 2:30:40 ago on Sun Oct 9 18:03:16 2016. Error: package krita-libs-3.0-3.fc25.x86_64 requires libkritacolord.so()(64bit), but none of the providers can be installed. package krita-3.0-3.fc25.x86_64 requires libkritabasicflakes.so.15()(64bit), but none of the providers can be installed. package krita-libs-3.0-3.fc25.x86_64 requires libkritacolord.so()(64bit), but none of the providers can be installed
Expected results: krita and krita-libs are installed
Additional info: libkritabasicflakes.so.15()(64bit) is provided by krita-libs libkritacolord.so()(64bit) is provided by calligra-krita-libs
My assumption is that calligra-krita-libs is the old obsolete version of the krita-libs package.

krita-3.0.1.1-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-58ca6e142e
krita-3.0.1.1-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
